definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: The chef's specialty is shrimps with crispy fried rice crust.
sentences.chinese: 廚師的拿手菜是蝦仁鍋巴。

sentences.english: Be regarded as the mother's that specialty vegetables, is also a can't stop come-on.
sentences.chinese: 就算是母親的那道拿手菜，也是一份不會停止的誘惑。

sentences.english: Would you like to try my special recipe?
The chef's speciality is shrimps with crispy fried rice crust.
sentences.chinese: 廚師的拿手菜是蝦仁鍋巴。

sentences.english: This is my wife's favorite dish.
I can recommend the chef's dish of the day.
sentences.chinese: 我可推薦廚師今天的拿手菜。

sentences.english: The chef 's specialty is shrimp with crispy fried rice crust .
sentences.chinese: 廚師的拿手菜是蝦仁鍋巴。

sentences.english: This is the specialty of our restaurant, sir.
sentences.chinese: 先生，這是本店的拿手菜。

sentences.english: Chef Wang has prepared a dish for us.
sentences.chinese: 今天王師傅爲我們做了一道拿手菜。

sentences.english: I want to cook my speciality dish.

definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
signature dish/a restaurant’s most famous dish
to be in charge of the cooking/to be the chef/head cook/chef
to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
dish (food prepared according to a specific recipe)
